function.description: Allows the user to enter their weight in either kilograms or pounds.
Allows the user to enter their height in either centimeters or feet and inches.
Provides options to choose between metric (kilograms and centimeters) and imperial (pounds and feet/inches) units.
Calculates the BMI based on the entered weight and height.
Shows the calculated BMI value.
Provides the corresponding BMI category (e.g., Underweight, Normal weight, Overweight, Obese) based on the calculated BMI.
Allows the user to clear the entered weight and height values.
Choose the currency I want to convert from a dropdown list.
Choose the currency I want to convert to from a dropdown list.
Input the numerical amount of the source currency I want to convert.
See the calculated equivalent amount in the target currency.
Click a button to initiate the conversion process.
Easily switch the source and target currencies with a single click or button.
See a list of my previous currency conversions.
Delete all or selected past conversion records.
Order past conversions by date, source currency, or target currency.
Specify the number of decimal places to display in the converted amount.
Use a pre-defined set of exchange rates.
Enter the text, URL, or other information to encode in the QR code.
Choose the type of data to encode (e.g., URL, text, contact information).
Change the color, add a logo, or customize the pattern of the QR code.
Click a button to generate the QR code based on the entered data and customization options.
Download the generated QR code in various formats (e.g., PNG, SVG, JPG).
See example QR codes for different data types and customization options.
See the different pricing plans available for the QR code generator service.
Compare the features offered by each pricing plan, such as the number of QR codes, customization options, and analytics.
Choose a pricing plan that suits your needs.
Access the API documentation to learn how to integrate the QR code generator into other applications.
Obtain an API key to authenticate requests to the QR code generator API.
Test the API endpoints with sample data to understand how the API works.
Read about the company behind the QR code generator, its mission, and team.
Find contact information to reach out to the company for support or inquiries.
A text area to input Markdown formatted text.
A display area to show the converted HTML.

A button to clear both the Markdown input and HTML output areas.
A button to copy the generated HTML to the clipboard.
Real-time conversion and display of HTML as Markdown is typed.
Dropdown or options to select different syntax highlighting themes for code blocks in the HTML output.
Option to configure the number of spaces used for tab indentation in the HTML output.
Option to control how line breaks are handled in the conversion (e.g., two spaces at the end of a line for hard breaks).
Toggle to enable or disable automatic numbering of headers in the HTML output.
Description of the Markdown to HTML converter, including its features and purpose.
Contact details or a link to a contact form for inquiries and feedback.
Display of the current version of the converter.

See a chart showing the number of completed todos over a specified time period.

Filter the chart data by date range or other relevant criteria.

Set preferences for receiving notifications about upcoming deadlines or other relevant events.

Displays the current month's calendar with days and dates.
Allows users to move forward and backward to view different months.
Allows users to jump to different years.
Returns the view to the current month and day.
Opens a form to create a new event on the selected day.
Displays details of an existing event on the selected day.
Allows modification of an existing event's details.
Removes an existing event from the selected day.
Allows input of a title for the event.
Allows selection of the date for the event.
Allows setting a start and end time for the event.
Allows inputting a description for the event.
Allows configuring reminders for the event.
Saves the newly created or edited event.
Discards changes and returns to the calendar view.
Allows choosing the default calendar view (month, week, day).
Allows setting the first day of the week (Sunday or Monday).
Configure notification settings for event reminders.
Allows importing or exporting calendar events to/from other calendar applications.
Personalize the calendar's appearance.
I want the chatbot to understand what I mean, even if I don't phrase things perfectly.

function.function: Respond in a natural and conversational way
function.description: The chatbot's replies should feel like a real conversation, not stiff or robotic.
I need the chatbot to give me correct answers and relevant information to my questions.
The chatbot should get better at understanding and responding to my needs as it interacts with me.
It would be great if the chatbot could connect with other apps or services I use.
The chatbot should remember my preferences and tailor its responses accordingly.
I want the chatbot to be able to communicate with me in different languages.
The chatbot should always be available when I need it.
I want the chatbot to understand my emotions and respond appropriately.
The chatbot should remember the previous conversation and keep the context in mind.
I want to clearly understand the different pricing options and what each includes.
I need different subscription plans to choose from, based on my usage needs.
I'd like to try the chatbot for free before committing to a paid plan.
I need a simple way to contact support if I have any questions or issues.
I want to receive quick and helpful responses from customer support.

Allows users to record the food and drinks they consume.
Displays the total calories consumed for the day, week, or month.

Provides a searchable database of foods with their nutritional information.

Allows users to add food items not found in the database.
Allows users to specify the quantity of food consumed.

Creates a report summarizing calorie intake over a specified period.

Allows the administrator to reject a pending claim with an optional reason for rejection.
Generates reports summarizing expenses by category (Travel, Labor, Management, or Equipment), date range, or employee.

Provides tools to set budgets for each expense category, track current spending against the budget, and receive alerts for potential overspending.  Allows visualization of budget allocation and spending trends.
Allows users to enter their credentials and log in to the system.  Redirects to the appropriate dashboard (employee or administrator) based on user role.

Reads a subject list from an Excel file ('Spring Semester Subjects.xlsx'), organizes it into a two-dimensional timetable format based on weekdays and time periods, and outputs the resulting table to a new Excel file ('Subject_Table.xlsx').

Creates a lagged version of the 'result' column.
Removes rows with missing values resulting from the lagging process.
Specifies the dependent and independent variables for the model.
Scales the independent variables to have zero mean and unit variance.
Adds a constant term (intercept) to the independent variables.
Fits a logistic regression model using the specified dependent and independent variables.
Saves the model summary to an Excel file (Logistic.xlsx).
Reads data from the specified CSV file.
Extracts the 'Date of Death' from each row.
Calculates the week number for each date of death.
Counts the number of deaths for each week.
